channel.title: A community, and things you look for in them
channel.description:
Well i am starting a community at [cant advertise but its in my sig] and am wondering how I can get a community going. I have alot of builders like graphics sections, a large arcade of 194 games, a soon to be chat box, and a ok marble skin. But I know theres more to a community then what it seems. I join communities that are large and that fit in with my interests. But I need to know what your opinion is.
Please help me out xD, John
Also I don't think this is the right place to post o.o

item.title: A community, and things you look for in them
item.dc:creator: @Sync Sync
item.description:
@Sync wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:11, topic:174965”]8. Fake the member count, sign up yourself 100 times and post[/quote]Lol, I tried that once, it’s effective if you’re slow on starting.
Never require people to be logged in to view the Forums, this almost instantly makes the members think that the Forum is in-active.

Read full topic
item.source: A community, and things you look for in them

item.title: A community, and things you look for in them
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

  1. Get a real domain.
  2. Be original
  3. Don’t expect people to register and post
  4. Be original
  5. Do what no one has done yet
  6. Or be lucky your fav forums went down cough mopar
  7. Be original
  8. Fake the member count, sign up yourself 100 times and post
  9. BE ORIGINAL

Read full topic
item.source: A community, and things you look for in them

item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:6, topic:174965”][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=235458.msg2006976#msg2006976 date=1200913409]

no advertising.

One of the first things you would do is to ban idiots like this ^

in his original post he was advertising his website…
[/quote]
Dude, he is still a fuckwit.[/quote]
MybJames speaks the truth, or does he?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Carson Carson
item.description:
@Carson wrote:

a soon to be chat box

That will not benefit your community ^

I look for nice staff members. That act like normal people, not robots that ban you for stupid reasons.
